CatDescriptText: Portion of possible related article published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper August 7, 1943, pg. 9, reads: "Talk O'Town... Two events took place last week. One being the reception Mrs. Major Illery gave her son Spurgeon and his bride, and a charming breakfast given in honor of some out-of-towners. Mrs. Illery chose for her assistants some of the town's most popular matrons and maids. Her new daughter-in-law was the former Roxie Lindsey of Akron, Ohio, and she made a beautiful honoree..."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of four women, wedding guests of Spurgeon Illery and Roxie Lindsey, posed in front of Illery home, 2839 Wylie Avenue, Hill District
